I'm gonna blame school for too much sitting:
Let's say we are at school for about 7 hours/day. Out of those 7 hours we probably spend at least 5 hours sitting down (and this doesn't include the buss ride that many people have to do every day) and after school we get homework, which probably takes about 1-2 hours to finish. That gives us about 7 hours that we have to sit down. AND if we add all meals (most people sit down when they eat) we can probably add another hour to that, which gives us about 8 hours. Yup, eight hours/day, that's NOT healthy, but in most cases there's not that much to do about it, we can't just go for a little walk in class, we have to do homework and study to get good grades. And whilst some people probably can walk to school instead of taking the bus, that's not the case for everyone. But if we were to ignore school, stop doing homework etc. to avoid sitting down as much and have a somewhat healthier lifestyle when we're young, we won't be able to get a proper education, and that would lead to shitty work.
